content: Dispersed Parallel Sysplex (GDPS) enables automatic management of the PUs that are provided by the CBU feature during a system or site failure. Upon detection of a site failure or planned disaster test, GDPS concurrently adds CPs to the systems in the take-over site to restore processing power for mission-critical production workloads. GDPS automation runs the following tasks:  The analysis that is required to determine the scope of the failure. This process minimizes operator intervention and the potential for errors.  Automates authentication and activation of the reserved CPs.  Automatically restarts the critical applications after reserved CP activation.  Reduces the outage time to restart critical workloads from several hours to minutes. The GDPS service is for z/OS only, or for z/OS in combination with Linux on Z. Note: System Recovery Boost record does not affect model capacity identifier. 370 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide 8.11 Flexible Capacity Cyber Resiliency Flexible
